intro: Calysericos argentea, commonly known as silverleaf calysericos, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Calysericos argentea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
